paper_abstract: A canal surface is an envelope of a one-parameter family of spheres. In this paper we present an efficient algorithm for computing the implicit equation of a canal surface generated by a rational family of spheres, By using Laguerre and Lie geometries, we relate the equation of the canal Surface to the equation Of a dual variety of a certain Curve in 5-dimensional projective space. We define the p-basis for arbitrary dimension and give a simple algorithm for its computation. This is then applied to the dual variety, which allows LIS to deduce the implicit equations of the dual variety, the canal Surface and any offset to the canal Surface. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. paper_title: The implicit equation of a canal surface
